remarks: An element of a ring is a unit of a subring iff it is a unit of the parent ring and both it and its inverse are in the subring. (Contributed by Mario Carneiro, 4-Dec-2014.)
statement:
subrgugrp.1 $e |- S = ( R |`s A ) $.
subrgugrp.2 $e |- U = ( Unit ` R ) $.
subrgugrp.3 $e |- V = ( Unit ` S ) $.
subrgunit.4 $e |- I = ( invr ` R ) $.
subrgunit $p |- ( A e. ( SubRing ` R ) -> ( X e. V <-> ( X e. U /\ X e. A /\ ( I ` X ) e. A ) ) ) $.
